section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: Explore Python's built-in data types, variable assignment rules, and memory management fundamentals through interactive coding exercises
learning_objectives: Create and assign variables using valid Python identifiers
Distinguish between mutable and immutable data types
Apply type conversion functions to transform data
Debug common variable naming and assignment errors

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will predict and verify variable memory addresses using id() after multiple assignments

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables x=10, y=x, x=20. Print the id() of each variable before and after reassignment to observe reference changes
Write a program that tests 10 different variable names and outputs whether each follows Python naming rules

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will demonstrate correct usage of int, float, and complex types while handling precision errors

exercises.exercise_instructions: Calculate 0.1 + 0.2 and compare to 0.3 using == operator, then fix the comparison using round() with 10 decimal places
Create two complex numbers and output their sum, difference, product, and conjugate values

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will extract substrings using positive and negative indices with stride parameters

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write code that checks if a 7-character string reads the same forwards and backwards using slicing
Take user input and print the reversed string without using the reverse() function

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will modify list contents while proving tuple immutability through error handling

exercises.exercise_instructions: Start with [1,2,3], insert 1.5 at index 1, remove the last element, and sort in descending order without creating new lists
Attempt to change the second element of a tuple inside try-except block and catch the specific error type

lessons.lesson_title: Dictionary Key Constraints and Set Operations
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will create dictionaries with immutable keys and perform mathematical set operations

exercises.exercise_instructions: Build a dictionary mapping student names to lists of grades, then calculate each student's average using dictionary methods
Given two sets {1,2,3,4} and {3,4,5,6}, output their union, intersection, symmetric difference, and difference results
